definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg

sentences.english: The Golden Rooster Award is given out once a year.
Xiu Han Dynasty by Wang Mang to kill this golden rooster lead the way by which name.
sentences.chinese: 因西漢末年劉秀遭王莽追殺到此金雞引路而名。

sentences.english: The doctor says that I should take quinine .
sentences.chinese: 醫生說我應該服用金雞納霜。

sentences.english: His balance is so good that he can stand on leg for 10 minutes without falling.
sentences.chinese: 他的平衡感很好，可以金雞獨立十分鐘都不會掉下來。

sentences.english: Quinine is a cure for colds.
sentences.chinese: 金雞納霜是治療風寒的藥方。

sentences.english: Coreopsis wildflowers bloom on the Texas coastal prairie.
sentences.chinese: 金雞菊野花開花在德克薩斯州海岸大草原。

sentences.english: She has won the best actress awards for the Paris Film Festival and the Golden Rooster in China.
sentences.chinese: 她已經贏得了巴黎電影節和中國金雞獎的最佳女主角。

sentences.english: We look forward to welcoming you at Kempinski Hotel Suzhou.
sentences.chinese: 我們恭候閣下光臨蘇州金雞湖凱賓斯基大酒店。

sentences.english: Nearby grew a tree, nowadays known as Cinchona.
sentences.chinese: 附近長着一顆樹，現在知道是一棵金雞納樹。

sentences.english: Cockscomb country is a god with chicken, but cockfighting always be defeated in big Long Guojin gallinaceous foot falls.
sentences.chinese: 雞冠國以雞爲神，但鬥雞總敗在大龍國金雞腳下。

sentences.english: The guy climbed up on the bar, stood on one leg, and began pissing all over the place.
sentences.chinese: 只見那人爬到吧檯上，來個金雞獨立，就開始撒尿。

sentences.english: It is in the new amusement park, which is one part of Jinji Lake Area.
sentences.chinese: 這座全新的主題公園，坐落於工業園區金雞湖東岸。

sentences.english: Sarah has amazing balance. She can stand on one foot all day long !
sentences.chinese: 莎拉平衡感超好，她可以金雞獨立一整天。

sentences.english: In an instant between, we had gone 2004, greeted golden pheasant caw to cry.
sentences.chinese: 轉眼之間，我們走過了2004，迎來了金雞啼鳴。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
beginning of spring/the lunar New Year
to announce good news/to report success
to extend New Year's greetings/to pay a New Year's visit
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
